peril.model.board

Class ModelArmy

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • peril.model.board.ModelArmy
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Iterable<ModelUnit>, Army

    public final class ModelArmy
extends java.util.Observable
implements java.lang.Iterable<ModelUnit>, Army
    Encapsulates the behaviour of a collection of ModelUnits. This army is Iterable and will iterate through all the ModelUnit types it contains, to get the number of each type of ModelUnit use getNumberOf(ModelUnit).
    Since:
    2018-03-12
    Version:
    1.02.05
    Author:
    Joshua_Eddy
    See Also:
    Observable, Iterable, Army, UnitHelper

    • Field Detail

      • units

        private final java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Integer> units
        Contains the ModelUnits that this ModelArmy consists of. The value of each key is the number of that ModelUnit in the ModelArmy.

      • selected

        private ModelUnit selected
        Holds the currently selected ModelUnit.

      • select

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        Returns whether the ModelUnit was selected or not.

      • deselect

        public void deselect()
        De-selected the currently selected ModelUnit.

      • remove

        public void remove(ModelUnit unit)
        Removes a specified ModelUnit from this ModelArmy. If the ModelUnit is not contained in this ModelArmy then:
        1. Check if the ModelUnit is larger than the ModelArmy, if so then ModelArmy will be reduced to the minimum size of zero.
        2. Check if the ModelUnit is weaker than this ModelArmy's strongest ModelUnit, if so then remove ModelUnits until the strength of the
        Parameters:
        unit - The ModelUnit that is to be removed. NOT NULL

      • remove

        public void remove(int strength)
        Removes a amount of ModelUnit strength from this ModelArmy. If the loss in strength would reduce the ModelArmy's strength to less than zero then the ModelArmy will be emptied.
        Parameters:
        strength - The amount of ModelUnit strength to remove.

      • removeRandomUnit

        public void removeRandomUnit()
        Removes a random ModelUnit from this ModelArmy.

      • hasUnit

        public boolean hasUnit(ModelUnit unit)
        Retrieves a whether a specific type of ModelUnit is currently in this ModelArmy.
        Parameters:
        unit - ModelArmy
        Returns:
        Whether a specific type of ModelUnit is currently in this ModelArmy.

      • getNumberOf

        public int getNumberOf(ModelUnit unit)
        Retrieves a number of a specific ModelUnit that are currently in this ModelArmy.
        Parameters:
        unit - ModelUnit that is in the ModelArmy. Use hasUnit(ModelUnit) to determine this.
        Returns:
        Number of a specific ModelUnit

      • tradeUp

        public boolean tradeUp(ModelUnit unit)
        Trades the ModelUnits of the specified type for as many of the ModelUnit above them according to UnitHelper.getUnitAbove(ModelUnit) as possible.

        Will return false if:
        • There is no ModelUnit above.
        • There is not enough of that ModelUnit in the ModelArmy to make one of the above ModelUnit.
        • The unit is not in the ModelArmy.
        Parameters:
        unit - ModelUnit to trade up.
        Returns:
        Whether or not the ModelUnit was traded up or not.

      • tradeDown

        public boolean tradeDown(ModelUnit unit)
        Converts one of the specified ModelUnit into its strength equivalent of the ModelUnit below it.

        Will return false if:
        • There is no ModelUnit below.
        • The unit is not in the ModelArmy.
        Parameters:
        unit - The ModelUnit to trade down.
        Returns:
        Whether the ModelUnit was traded down.

      • tradeUnitsUp

        public boolean tradeUnitsUp()
        Trades all the ModelUnits in the ModelArmy up to make this ModelArmy as strong as possible.
        Returns:
        Whether any of the ModelUnits in this ModelArmy were traded up.

      • getVarietyOfUnits

        public int getVarietyOfUnits()
        Returns the number of different types of ModelUnits in this ModelArmy.
        Returns:
        Variety of ModelUnits.

      • iterator

        public java.util.Iterator<ModelUnit> iterator()
        Retrieves the Iterator for this ModelArmy of all the ModelUnits inside. The number of each ModelUnit in specific can be found using getNumberOf(ModelUnit).
        Specified by:
        iterator in interface java.lang.Iterable<ModelUnit>

      • merge

        public void merge(ModelArmy army)
        Adds all of the ModelUnits from the specified ModelArmy into this ModelArmy. This will not remove the ModelUnits from the specified ModelArmy.
        Parameters:
        army - The ModelArmy to be merged.

      • setStrength

        public void setStrength(int strength)
        Set strength of this ModelArmy and the ModelUnits will be generated using generateUnits(int).
        Parameters:
        strength - The new strength of the ModelArmy.

      • setWeakest

        public void setWeakest()
        Set this ModelArmy to have one of the weakest ModelUnit according to UnitHelper.getWeakest().

      • getStrongestUnit

        public ModelUnit getStrongestUnit()
        Retrieves the strongest ModelUnit in this ModelArmy.
        Specified by:
        getStrongestUnit in interface Army
        Returns:
        Strongest ModelUnit in this ModelArmy.

      • generateUnits

        public static java.util.List<ModelUnit> generateUnits(int strength)
        Generates a List of ModelUnits who's combined strength is equal to the specified strength. This method will prioritise the strongest ModelUnits first according to UnitHelper.getStrongest(). The Specified strength should not be or result in a strength lower than the weakest ModelUnit's strength according to UnitHelper.getWeakest().
        Parameters:
        strength - The combined strength of the List of ModelUnits.
        Returns:
        List of ModelUnit.

      • getNumberOfUnits

        public int getNumberOfUnits()
        Retrieves the number of ModelUnits in this ModelArmy.
        Specified by:
        getNumberOfUnits in interface Army
        Returns:
        Number of ModelUnits

      • getUnits

        public java.util.Set<? extends Unit> getUnits()
        Description copied from interface: Army
        Retrieves the Units from this Army. This does not reflect the number of each Unit in the Army
        Specified by:
        getUnits in interface Army
        Returns:
        The Set<Unit> of Units.
